trustfund:
TF026791-PHRD-MADAGASCAR: POVERTY
            REDUCTION AND INSTITUTIONAL DEVELOPMENT TECHNI

abstracts.cdata!:
The Governance and Institutional
            Development Project will assist the Government of Madagascar
            implement the poverty reduction strategy, as set in the
            Poverty Reduction Strategy Paper (PRSP), by rationalizing
            and modernizing budget, and public expenditure management;
            improving accountability and transparency of Government
            operations; and, by strengthening the capacity of public
            institutions, in light of complex change processes. The two
            main components address the following: 1) Improving
            transparency, and economic governance will require a
            comprehensive reform of the public finance system, for which
            the component will include: a) budget preparation, and
            management, on the basis of a comprehensive computerized
            system, to which all agencies involved in budget, and
            expenditure management would be connected. The system would
            encompass the whole national budget, i.e., wages, non-salary
            operating costs, investment, debt service, income
            mobilization (customs, taxes); b) adjusting the existing
            institutional, and procedural framework to international
            standards. In this context, the project will support the
            establishment of an independent internal audit function in
            the Ministry of Finance and Budget, the strengthening of
            other control functions, and, the transformation of the
            Office of the Auditor General; c) adjusting the public
            procurement system to international standards, through a
            comprehensive reform of the regulatory, and institutional
            framework, as well as significant capacity building, to
            ensure compliance with new rules and regulations; and, d)
            support capacity building activities to strengthen
            information for decision making, management, public
            investment oversight, policy analysis, evaluation and
            reorientation of policies, and programs within the context
            of the PRSP. 2) Focus on institutional development and
            capacity building activities in selected government
            institution, such as strengthening capacities to complement
            the significant changes triggered by financial and
            institutional reforms; continuing the judicial reform
            through improved operational efficiency, particularly
            regarding expeditious civil, and commercial proceedings, and
            by improving the delivery of selected public services with
            large public-private interface. In addition, the project
            will support the establishment of a project management
            system, to ensure effective implementation of the reforms.
